item.title: Internet privacy starter pack
item.description: About a month ago I began using some systems to protect my security on the internet a bit more than nothing. PiHole It started when someone shared a link to the PiHole on Twitter. It is a self-hosted DNS service that is designed for RaspberryPi for blocking advertisements and trackers on the DNS level. Turns out, about 20% of queries I make are blocked, and it doesn’t hurt daily usage at all.
